function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Inadequate infrastructure for controlling vector-borne disease risks","Closure of entire cities and stringent measures","Global data sharing and management may conflict with various countries’ laws and regulations, leading to legal challenges and regulatory non-compliance","Global movement of people leading to enhanced transmission of contagious diseases","Air transportation facilitating rapid spread of coronavirus","Less preparedness of global cities due to lack of information on outbreak issues","Challenges in data access due to sensitivity for national security reasons","Significant impacts on local economies due to disease outbreaks","Increased risk of violence prompted by forced evictions, land conflicts, and resource scarcity in cities","Environmental degradation and safety concerns from natural disasters like flooding and extreme heat waves","Dependence on advanced technologies introduces vulnerability to cyber attacks","Increased conflicts and crimes due to disparities and deprivations in cities","Potential privacy concerns arising from the use of surveillance and data extraction technologies in urban developments","Challenges in managing the safe city concept due to lack of uniformity in protocols and centralized networks, leading to increased complexity and cost","Fear and discomfort among citizens due to surveillance and data privacy concerns","Vulnerability of data leading to espionage and financial exploitation","Increased reliance on ai technology for health data analysis","Potential limitations in using 5g and 6g technologies for telemedicine, teleworking, and real-time communication in health sector"]}
